alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 10:07PM EDT until July 13 at 2:32AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Hampshire and Franklin Counties. Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Berkshire and Franklin Counties. West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont, West Deerfield... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Montague. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Flooding will expand into portions of Montague and Greenfield downstream through Sunderland and Whately. Some residential areas may become inundated and localized road closures may be needed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 29.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EDT Monday was 29.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 35.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.4 feet on 03/28/1953. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1015 AM EDT.
